metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14176 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Bazaar through 2.7.0, when Subprocess SSH is used, allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary commands via a bzr+ssh URL with an initial dashcharacter in the hostname, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800,CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-12976, CVE-2017-16228, CVE-2017-1000116, andCVE-2017-1000117.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bzr - 2.7.0-2ubuntu3.1
python-bzrlib - 2.7.0-2ubuntu3.1
python-bzrlib.tests - 2.7.0-2ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bzr package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-2ubuntu3.1').
